used to tell someone that you are grateful for something they have given you or done for you
Margaret handed him the butter. ‘Thank you, ’ said Samuel.
It’s good to see you, Mr Mathias. Thank you for coming.
Dear Grandma, thank you for the lovely shirt you sent me for Christmas.
used as a polite way of accepting something that someone has offered
‘Can I give you a lift into town?’ ‘Oh, thank you.’
used when politely answering someone’s question
‘How was your trip to Paris?’ ‘Very nice, thank you.’
used at the end of a sentence when telling someone firmly that you do not want their help or advice and are slightly annoyed by it
I can manage quite well on my own, thank you!
something you say or do in order to thank someone
This present’s a thank-you for helping me last week.
I just want to say a big thank-you to everyone who supported us.
